name: Theory and Practice of Multimedia Production
info: Combines the traditional media production pipeline and software engineering processes to synthesize an approach geared for the production of works incorporating both artistic and computational elements.
text: THE ART OF GAME DESIGN: A BOOK OF LENSES, SECOND EDITION by JESSE SCHELL

name: Introduction to Computer Aided Animation
info: Introduces topics related to computer-aided animation. Rigging for forward and inverse kinematics. Skin weighting. Morph targets. Expression-driven animation, rigid-body and particle simulation.

name: Malware Reverse Engineering
info: Introduction to the theory and practice of software reverse engineering applied to the analysis of malicious software (malware). Students will learn techniques of static and dynamic analysis to help identify the full spectrum of the behavior of code that is presented without documentation or source code and to identify possible remediation and avoidance techniques. The course will use a large number of software tools employed by malware and computer forensic analysts.

name: Deep Learning for Computer Graphics
info: This undergraduate course covers deep learning basics, related math and the fundamental theory and application of AI algorithms most popular in the field of computer graphics. Programming assignments will help students develop GPU programming skills while implementing concepts learned in lectures and readings using deep learning APIs on a GPU cluster. Convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for colorizing black and white movies is an example.
text: Deep Learning by Ian Goodfellow and Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville

name: Computational Structures in Computer Graphics
info: Studies the major topics in computer graphics: display and output technology, two and three dimensional manipulations; space curves and surfaces, hidden surface removal and shading models.

name: Introduction to Data Science
info: Introduces the basics of data science including programming for data analytics, file management, relational databases, classification, clustering, and regression; lays the foundation for big data applications ranging from social networks to medical and business informatics.

name: Human Computer Interaction
info: Topics related to interaction with technology, including interface design, software tools, 3-D interaction, virtual environments, interaction devices, collaboration, and visualization.
preq: Prereq: COP 3530, and any one programming course (COP 2800, COP 3275, or COP 3229).

name: Research Methods for Human Centered Computing
info: Introduces the fundamental methods and techniques to evaluate technologies and collect data from humans, including experimental design, types of variables, types of errors, hypothesis testing, survey design, behavioral and psychophysical methods.
preq: Prereq: STA 3032, COT 3100, COP 3530, or equivalent.
text: Research Methods in Human-Computer Interaction by Lazar, Feng, & Hochheiser

name: Malware Reverse Engineering
info: Introducing the theory and practice of software reverse engineering applied to analysis of malicious software (malware). Students learn techniques of static and dynamic analysis to help identify the behavior of programs presented without documentation or source code and to identify possible remediation and avoidance techniques.
preq: Prereq: CDA 3101 ; Coreq: COP 5615 or consent of instructor.
text: MALWARE ANALYST’S COOKBOOK AND DVD by M. LIGH, S. ADAIR, B. HARTSTEIN, M. RICHARD

name: Machine Learning
info: Concepts in developing computer programs that learn and improve with experience. Emphasis on methods based on probability, statistics, and optimization.
text: MACHINE LEARNING: A PROBABILISTIC PERSPECTIVE by KEVIN P. MURPHY

name: Neural Networks for Computing
info: Neural network models and algorithms. Adaptive behavior, associative learning, competitive dynamics and biological mechanisms. Applications include computer vision, cognitive information processing, control, and signal analysis.

name: Introduction to Computer Organization
info: Organization of computing systems. Logical basis of computer structure. Machine representation of instructions and data, flow of control, and basic machine instructions. Assembly language programming. (M)
preq: Prereq: (COP 3504 or COP 3503) and (MAC 2233 or MAC 2311 or MAC 3472) and COT 3100.
text: COMPUTER ORGANIZATION AND DESIGN by PATTERSON, HENNESSY

name: Introduction to Software Engineering
info: Topics include software planning, specifications, coding, testing and maintenance. Gain experience in the team approach to large system development. (M)

name: Software Testing and Verification
info: Concepts, principles and techniques of software testing and verification. Strengths and limitations of black-box and white-box testing methods; techniques for proving the correctness of programs.

name: Human Computer Interaction
info: Studies the major topics in the study, planning and design of the interaction between people and computers. Topics include interface design (principles, theories and guidelines), virtual environments, interactive devices and collaboration.

name: User Experience Design
info: Introduces methods and tools used in User Experience Design (UXD): the early stages of software design focused on meeting user needs. Key concepts include user research, contextual design, design thinking, ideation, iterative design, prototyping, and design documentation. Projects utilize software tools used in the industry.

name: Computer and Information Science and Engineering Design 2
info: Involves completing a significant CEN-related project. Coordinate with the instructor and a project advisor, prepare a detailed technical report and deliver an oral presentation.

name: Software Engineering
info: Topics in projects organization, specification techniques, reliability measurement, documentation.

name: Software Testing and Verification
info: Concepts, principles, and methods for software testing and verification. Topics include human and machine-based testing strategies, formal proofs of correctness, and software reliability.

name: Legal and Social Issues in Computing
info: Explores the history, the myth, the ethics, the law and the risks of computer-based technology in modern society. Emphasizes critical analysis of hypotheticals and case studies. Published material is supplemented with online references.
preq: Prereq: previous experience in Unix environment.

name: Enterprise Security
info: Provides an introduction to the real-world aspects of defending an enterprise network. Students will gain hands-on experience performing system security tasks and handling incidents. The class begins with a basic introduction to enterprise cybersecurity, the attack sequence, and managing cybersecurity. Then lecture, homework and lab activities cover the center for internet security's twenty essential security controls.

name: Information and Database Systems 1
info: First part of a two-course sequence that studies the essential concepts, principles and techniques of modern database systems. Topics include modeling and querying of data using conceptual data models as well as the development of a database application. (M)

name: Computer and Information Security
info: Covers systematic threat and risk assessment; programmed threats and controls in hardware, software, and human procedures; security policies, models, and mechanisms; theoretical limitations and practical implementations; certification and accreditation standards; and case study reviews. Includes projects.

name: CS Teaching   Learning
info: Covers basic pedagogy, especially as it relates to computer science and engineering, and covers three fundamental elements in education: learning environment, educational theory, and educational practice as approached to engineering-specific training.

name: Individual Study in CISE  INDIVIDUAL STUDY
info: Problems in different areas of computer science.

name: Senior Project
info: Involves completing a significant CISE-related project. Coordinate with the instructor and a project advisor, prepare a detailed technical report and deliver an oral presentation. (M)
preq: Prereq: senior CISE standing and approved project proposal.

name: Net Analytics   ML
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.

name: Software Security
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.

name: Intro to Comp Prog
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.

name: Digital Health
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.

name: Probability in CS
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.

name: Mobile Computing
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.

name: Applied ML
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.
text: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow: Concepts, Tools, and Techniques to Build Intelligent System by Aurélien Géron

name: Internet Network Tech
info: Variable content provides an opportunity for in-depth study of topics not offered elsewhere and of topics of current significance.
text: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach by KUROSE

name: Practical Work
info: One term practical software engineering work under industrial supervision as set forth in the Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering regulations. (S-U)

name: Computer and Information Security
info: Covers systematic threat and risk assessment; programmed threats and controls in hardware, software, and human procedures; security policies, models, and mechanisms; theoretical limitations and practical implementations; certification and accreditation standards; and case study reviews. Coursework includes a significant term project.
preq: Prereq: COP 4600 Operating Systems or equivalent

name: Introduction to Cryptology
info: Introducing classical and modern cryptography and cryptanalysis, including symmetric and asymmetric (public key) ciphers. It covers cryptographic hash functions, block and stream ciphers, as well as differential and linear cryptanalysis. It reviews BAN logic, applications of cryptography, cryptographic standards and protocols, and analyzes case studies of failed implementations.
preq: Prereq: COT 3100 Applications of Discrete Structures or equivalent ; Coreq:  COT 5405 Analysis of Algorithms or equivalent

name: Individual Study
info: Individual Study
preq: Prereq: consent of faculty member supervising the study.

name: Supervised Research
info: Supervised Research

name: Hum Cen Reco Alg
info: Special Topics in CIS

name: Digital Health
info: Special Topics in CIS

name: Net Analytics   ML
info: Special Topics in CIS

info: Special Topics in CIS

name: ML in Genomics
info: Special Topics in CIS

name: Probability for CS
info: Special Topics in CIS

name: Blockchain
info: Special Topics in CIS

name: Graduate Seminar
info: Presentations by visiting researchers, faculty members, and graduate students.

name: Supervised Teaching
info: A supervised teaching experience.

name: Research for Master s Thesis
info: Research for Master's Thesis

name: Advanced Research
info: Research for doctoral students before admission to candidacy. Designed for students with a master's degree in the field of study or for students who have been accepted for a doctoral program. Not appropriate for students who have been admitted to candidacy.

name: Research for Doctoral Dissertation
info: Research for Doctoral Dissertation

name: Computer Network Fundamentals
info: Fundamental concepts, principles, and standards of computer networks. Introduces topics in top-down approach, starting with the application layer in the OSI system architecture with a stronger focus on application, transport, and network layers.
text: COMPUTER NETWORKING: A TOP-DOWN APPROACH by JAMES KUROSE, KEITH ROSS

name: Computer Networks
info: Design, implementation, and internals of networks. Routing, congestion control, internetworking, TCP/IP, optimization, and proxy services.

name: Mobile Computing
info: Emerging topics of wireless and mobile computing and networking including mobile computing models, mobile-IP, adhoc networks, Bluetooth, and 802.11b. Mobile database access and mobile transactions in context of emerging field of M-commerce.

name: Advanced Computer Networks
info: Computer network architecture, including topologies, media, switching, routing, congestion control, protocols, and case studies.

name: Programming Fundamentals 1
info: First course of a two-semester introductory sequence for those planning further study in computer science, digital arts and sciences or computer engineering. Concepts of computer science and the process of computer programming, including object-oriented programming, procedural and data abstraction and program modularity.
text: PROGRAMMING IN JAVA WITH ZYLABS by ROMAN LYSECKY, ADRIAN LIZARRAGA

name: Programming Fundamentals 2
info: Second course of a two-semester introductory sequence for those planning further study in computer science, digital arts and sciences or computer engineering. Concepts of computer science and the process of computer programming, including object-oriented programming, procedural and data abstraction and program modularity.
preq: Prereq: (COP 3502 with a minimum grade of C or an AP exam in computer science with a minimum grade of 4) and MAC 2311 with a minimum grade of C.

name: Data Structures and Algorithm
info: Algorithm development using pseudo languages, basic program structures, program design techniques, storage and manipulation of basic data structures like arrays, stacks, queues, sorting and searching and string processing. Linked linear lists. Trees and multilinked structures. (M)
preq: Prereq: (COP 3504 or COP 3503) and COT 3100 and (MAC 2234 or MAC 2312 or MAC 2512 or MAC 3473), all with a minimum grade of C.
text: DATA STRUCTURES & ALGORITHM ANALYSIS IN C++ by WEISS

name: Programming Language Concepts
info: Introduces programming language principles, including language constructs, design goals, run-time structures, implementation techniques and exposure to a wide variety of programming paradigms.

name: Algorithm Abstraction and Design
info: Covers algorithmic concepts and their use rooted in practical application and computer science theory. Topics include algorithmic paradigms, limits of computing, and algorithm time complexity classes.

name: Operating Systems
info: Design and implementation of various components of a modern operating system, including I/O programming, interrupt handling, process and resource management, computer networks and distributed systems. (M)
preq: Prereq: CDA 3101 and COP 3530; knowledge of C or C++ recommended.

name: Information and Database Systems 2
info: Part two of a two-course sequence. Provides a basic understanding of the internals of a modern database system. Topics include data storage, indexing, query processing and advanced concepts such as database tuning, alternate data models and emerging applications. (M)

name: Database System Implementation
info: DBMS architecture, query processing and optimization, transaction processing, index structures, parallel query processing, object-oriented and object-relational databases, and related topics.

name: Applications of Discrete Structures
info: Covers the mathematics of discrete events; i.e., events that involve distinct elements, finite structures of distinct elements or finite sampled versions of continuous phenomena (such as movement). (M)
preq: Prereq: (MAC 2311 or MAC 3472) and (COP 3502 or equivalent), all with a minimum grades of C; Coreq: COP 3504 or COP 3503.

name: Numerical Analysis  a Computational Approach
info: Numerical integration, nonlinear equations, linear and nonlinear systems of equations, differential equations and interpolation.

name: Analysis of Algorithms
info: Introduction and illustration of basic techniques for designing efficient algorithms and analyzing algorithm complexity.

name: Mathematics for Intelligent Systems
info: Mathematical methods commonly used to develop algorithms for computer systems that exhibit intelligent behavior.
preq: Prereq: MAC 2313, Multivariate Calculus; MAS 3114 or MAS 4105, Linear Algebra; STA 4321, Mathematical Statistics.

name: Engineering Directed Independent Research  ENGINEERING RESEARCH
info: Provides firsthand, supervised research with a faculty advisor or postdoctoral or graduate student mentor. Projects may involve inquiry, design, investigation, scholarship, discovery or application. (S-U)

name: Practicum Internship Cooperative Work Experience
info: Practical cooperative engineering work under approved industrial and faculty supervision.

name: Engineering Graduate Research  ENGINEERING GRAD RSCH
info: Course will provide the student with supervised research in a laboratory setting.
